intro: Lappula sarawschanica, commonly known as the Sarawak lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Camelineae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. It has a short life cycle and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
